content.description: This short climb follows a left-facing flake system.  Once the flakes are surmounted (crux), move left onto the rounded arete and head up on easier ground.
content.protection: About midway, the the flake system accepts small pro that will protect the crux moves.  The top is runout but easy.  A tree at the top provides a nearly perfect toprope anchor.
content.location: This short climb ascends the obvious flake system on the right side of the buttress.

content.description: This is a slab face climb that is maybe easier than it looks.  It shares the finish with the Pipeline Flake.
content.protection: None.  There is a great top rope tree at the top.
content.location: This is to the left of the Pipeline Flake on the other side of the rounded arete.

content.description:
This is a small, slabby buttress with a few short, decent climbs.  The rock is typical high quality Cape Ann granite.   

  The mossy gully on the far right might offer some ice "bouldering" in season. 

  L->R: 

  A. Pipeline Face, 6, 1p, 25', TR.   B. Pipeline Flake, 8, 1p, 25', TR.
